programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.desc: New Zealand's Ryan Fox captures his first PGA TOUR win in an exciting playoff in Myrtle Beach, SC.

programme.title: Scottie Scheffler Wins TOUR Championship
programme.desc: Scottie Scheffler captures the FedExCup trophy with his win at the 2024 TOUR Championship. This is Scheffler's seventh PGA TOUR victory of the season and 13th career win.

programme.title: Austin Eckroat Wins the Cognizant Classic
programme.desc: Austin Eckroat gets his first victory on the PGA TOUR after winning the 2024 Cognizant Classic in The Palm Beaches. Eckroat carded rounds of 65-67-68-67 to finish 17-under par.

programme.title: 2015 Truist Championship
programme.desc: Rory McIlroy set the tournament record by five shots at 21-under par for his 11th PGA TOUR win.

programme.title: Hideki Matsuyama Wins The Genesis Invitational 2024
programme.desc: Hideki Matsuyama captures his ninth victory on the PGA TOUR, winning The Genesis Invitational 2024 after starting the day with six shots off the lead. Matsuyama shot rounds of 69-68-68-62 to finish 17-under par.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer – While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.title: 2024 Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade
programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: 2024 Player's Top Ten Fueled by Gatorade
programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down the top ten of this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: Outlaws
programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.desc: University of Utah turns club lacrosse into NCAA lacrosse team

programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down the top ten of this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: Outlaws
programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.title: Going West
programme.desc: University of Utah turns club lacrosse into NCAA lacrosse team

programme.title: Chicago Needs a PLL Team | All-Access Vlog
programme.desc: RJ takes you behind the scenes of the jam packed Chicago PLL weekend in an all-access video.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer – While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $5,000 Seven Card Stud World Championship attracted 144 entrants and created a prize pool of $676,800. The WSOP bracelet and $221,000 first-place prize would look to be claimed by a savvy group of final tablists that included Marcel Luske, Jeff Lisandro, Joe Awada, Cory Zeidman, Dewey Tomko and John Juanda.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Phil Hellmuth headlines the $3,000 Pot-Limit Hold'em final table that includes Ram Vaswani and Phi Nguyen, while Gavin Griffin chases the title of youngest WSOP bracelet of all-time if he can emerge victorious. Who will win the $270,420 first-place prize and prestigious WSOP bracelet?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The only straight Razz tournament of the 2004 WSOP would see a field of 195 players. Chris Bjorin, Hoyt Corkins, John Juanda, Howard Lederer, and Dutch Boyd all look to deny T.J. Cloutier his fifth WSOP bracelet as all eyes are on the $90,500 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #5: $10,000 8-Game final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Cary Katz is the chip leader ahead of Nick Guagenti, Alex Livingston, Steve Zolotow, Benjamin Diebold, Jacky Wang, and Brian Rast, as the final seven players play for the $186,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: The Train Robbers
programme.desc: After the death of her husband, Mrs. Lowe (Ann-Margret) posts a $50,000 reward in return for help recovering her train-robber beau's hidden fortune, under the pretense of returning it. Lane (John Wayne) assembles a group of cowboys to head to Mexico with Mrs. Lowe, enticed by the reward money. As they cross into Mexico, however, they realize they're being followed, by both a posse of bandits and a single mysterious rider (Ricardo Montalban) with his own agenda.

programme.title: The Cheyenne Social Club
programme.desc: Cowboy John O'Hanlan (James Stewart) is surprised to learn that someone's left him a business in Cheyenne, Wyo. He sets out to claim it -- and is shocked to discover that it's a brothel. Madam Jenny (Shirley Jones), who runs the place, is dismayed when O'Hanlan wants to close it down, but his plans are derailed when he finds out that a local customer has beaten Jenny. He kills the man in a shootout, and then must protect himself and the girls from the dead man's vengeful clan.

programme.title: Firecreek
programme.desc: Johnny Cobb (James Stewart) is the part-time sheriff in a small, rundown town, trying to stretch his meager salary to provide for his growing family. Poor Cobb isn't much of a gunman, and he isn't particularly suited for fighting, but he's the man in charge when a gang of bandits led by Bob Larkin (Henry Fonda) rides into town. The tension rises as the bandits make themselves at home in Cobb's town, but when a gunfight breaks out, Cobb finds himself pushed to the limit.

programme.title: The Naked Spur
programme.desc: Howard Kemp (James Stewart) has been tracking killer Ben Vandergroat (Robert Ryan) for a long time. In the Colorado Rockies, he teams up with prospector Jesse Tate (Millard Mitchell) and former Union soldier Roy Anderson (Ralph Meeker). Thinking Kemp is a sheriff, they agree to help for a small fee. When they catch Vandergroat, he tells them Kemp is pursuing a $5,000 bounty. After demanding equal shares, the uneasy alliance heads for Kansas as Vandergroat tries to turn them against each other.

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: Questions arise when Senator Stoddard (James Stewart) attends the funeral of a local man named Tom Doniphon (John Wayne) in a small Western town. Flashing back, we learn Doniphon saved Stoddard, then a lawyer, when he was roughed up by a crew of outlaws terrorizing the town, led by Liberty Valance (Lee Marvin). As the territory's safety hung in the balance, Doniphon and Stoddard, two of the only people standing up to him, proved to be very important, but different, foes to Valance.

programme.title: Tall Man Riding
programme.desc: A few years ago, Larry Madden (Randolph Scott) left his fiancée, Corinna (Dorothy Malone), after a run-in with her father, the wealthy land owner Tucker Ordway (Robert Barrat). After saving a man (William Ching) from a vicious attack, Larry learns hen is actually Corinna's new husband, and that some of the locals are preparing to challenge Tucker's land ownership. When Larry decides to ride back into town and make a claim himself, he encounters a few unexpected obstacles.

programme.title: Riding Shotgun
programme.desc: Larry Delong (Randolph Scott) loses his sister and her son when they're gunned down by the notorious Dan Marady (James Millican) and his band of outlaws during a holdup. Delong takes a job as a stagecoach guard, hoping to run into the bandits and take revenge. Run into them he does, but numbers are on Marady's side, and they shoot up and rob Delong's coach. Delong barely escapes with his life. When he tries to alert the authorities, they implicate him in the crime, and he becomes a fugitive.

programme.title: Thunder Over the Plains
programme.desc: It's the late 1860s, and the U.S. government has yet to reclaim Texas as a state. A group of opportunistic and amoral Northerners head south to claim the territory as their own. Though Texas lawman Capt. Porter (Randolph Scott) believes it's his duty to honor the local leaders, he can't ignore the corruption of the Yankee politicians who are giving him orders. When Confederate veteren Ben (Charles McGraw) is unjustly sentenced to death, Porter decides he has had enough of his new bosses.

programme.title: Trail Street
programme.desc: Legendary lawman Bat Masterson (Randolph Scott) is called to rural Kansas to defend farmers from ruthless cattlemen. Joining Masterson in his efforts to clean up a lawless town are a couple of locals: Masterson's old chum Billy Burn and landowner Allen Harper (Robert Ryan). But ranch owner Logan Maury proves to be a more than formidable opponent. He'll stop at nothing, including murder, to turn the farmers' fields into grazing grounds for his cattle.

programme.title: Fort Worth
programme.desc: Reformed gunman Ned Britt (Randolph Scott) travels to Fort Worth, Texas, to take over the abandoned newspaper. Crooked trail boss Gabe Clevenger (Ray Teal), a former antagonist of Ned's, challenges him on the trail. Ned refuses to fight -- which disappoints fellow passenger Flora Talbot (Phyllis Thaxter), who had taken a liking to him but now sees him as weak. In Fort Worth, Ned discovers Clevenger is battling the burgeoning railroad and decides to fight back using the power of the press.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Live in New York City
programme.desc: With a shiny happy exterior, an offbeat, demented interior and direction from Rob Zombie, Tom Papa’s “Live In New York City” attacks our hilarious attempts at happiness as life piles up around us. He jokes about becoming a parent, family pets, and boundaries for technology.

programme.title: The Legendary Roast of the Legendariest of Legend Rich Vos
programme.desc: Rich Vos gets savagely roasted on his birthday by his wife Bonnie McFarlane and other celebrity comedian friends including Colin Quinn, Jim Norton, Robert Kelly, Jay Oakerson and more.

programme.title: Morgan Murphy: Irish Goodbye
programme.desc: Wry and brilliant, Morgan Murphy delivers her sharpest, funniest jokes in this comedy special, showcasing her unmatched wit and humor.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: The comic performs in St. Louis, discussing Christmas as a child, feeling guilty on Mother's Day, Thanksgiving and Disneyland.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: The Comedy Vaccine (Extended Edition)
programme.desc: The Saul Goodman heavy takes his fifth stand-up special to Tempe, Arizona and he’s not holding back about anything—especially COVID-19.

programme.title: Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
programme.desc: The SNL alum, radio host, and film actor clears the air at his live event, chronicling his transformation from oddball child to ultimate family man.

programme.title: Jim Breuer: And Laughter For All
programme.desc: Marriage and parenthood won't keep die-hard metalhead comedian Jim Breuer from losing his manic sense of humor in this hilarious live show.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: Altamont
programme.desc: Comedian Jay Mohr tackles subjects from unexpected visitors, bringing up children to working with Chris Farley on SNL in his new stand-up special.

programme.title: Bill Engvall: Here's Your Sign It's Finally Time My Last Show
programme.desc: After spending over four decades delighting audiences, the renowned comedian takes the stage for the last time in his farewell stand-up special.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Michael Ian Black: Very Famous
programme.desc: Michael Ian Black is very famous. Well, he’s not that famous, but he keeps telling the world he is. Filmed live in Philadelphia, Michael Ian Black’s sarcastic sense of humor comes to the stage in his latest comedy special.

programme.title: Michael Ian Black: Noted Expert
programme.desc: You know him from his hilarious work in sketch, TV, and film, but the comedian’s NYC special takes his deadpan delivery to a whole new level.

programme.title: Sinbad: Make Me Wanna Holla
programme.desc: A stand-up special covering the everything from the life advice his parents gave him to people with no talent having clothing lines and more.

programme.title: Sinbad: Where U Been
programme.desc: Sinbad hits the stage hard as he speaks truth to the burning subjects of the day, from poverty and politics to where he's been keeping himself.

programme.title: Preacher Lawson: Get to Know Me
programme.desc: The comedian and “America’s Got Talent” finalist spills all about incontinence in his pants, sleeping in a race-car bed as a teen, and being vegan.

programme.title: Tone Bell: Can't Cancel This
programme.desc: The comic offers his humorously uncompromising views on a more fair world, where Alaska is cold, student loans are paid, and jelly is free.

programme.title: Peppermint: So-SIGH-ety Effects
programme.desc: Actress, singer, and all-around performer Peppermint offers an inside look at what it’s like to date in New York City as a transgender Black woman.

programme.title: Tj: January 3rd
programme.desc: After eight years performing in America, Haitian-born stand-up comedian Tanael Joachim debuts his first TV special. Recorded live in Brooklyn.

programme.title: Jinkx Monsoon: Red Head Redemption
programme.desc: Jinkx Monsoon recounts some of the crazier tales from her sex-addicted, alcoholic past, which led to her finding her true self.

programme.title: Elon Gold: Chosen & Taken
programme.desc: Elon Gold unleashes his sharp, biting humor in his comedy special Chosen & Taken. His manic wit transcends race and religion to celebrate the absurd things people do.

programme.title: Bob Saget: That’s What I’m Talkin’ About
programme.desc: Known for being family friendly, funnyman Bob Saget transforms into a foul-mouthed explainer and raconteur in this live stage show from Seattle.

programme.title: Bob Saget: Zero to Sixty
programme.desc: The popular stand-up declares himself to be the last TV father viewers can trust, as he shares funny words of wisdom and new, original comedy so

programme.title: Brent Weinbach: Appealing to the Mainstream
programme.desc: Comedian Brent Weinbach delivers a comedy set geared at adjusting his quirky and absurd viewpoints in order to gain mainstream show biz success.

programme.title: Gary Gulman: Boyish Man
programme.desc: Last Comic Standing alum, Gary Gulman, delivers with his clever wit and handsome boyish charm. Boyish Man features Hanukkah vs. Christmas, all kinds of cookies (and crackers) dating, sex… and everything in between.

programme.title: Gary Gulman: In This Economy?
programme.desc: In this stand-up special, money is a wellspring for the comedy of funnyman Gary Gulman, who aims darts at the überwealthy -- including Donald Trump.

programme.title: Larry the Cable Guy: Remain Seated
programme.desc: Larry the Cable Guy is back to "Git R Done" in his latest solo special from the Rialto Square Theater in Joliet, IL.

programme.title: Tiffany Haddish: She Ready! From the Hood to Hollywood!
programme.desc: The sensational “Girls Trip” star shares about her positive outlook on life, growing up in the foster care system, and working with legends.

programme.title: Whitney Cummings: Money Shot
programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Achmed Saves America
programme.desc: The world's most incompetent terrorist finds himself whisked away from his homeland and taken to Americaville, USA.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Very Special Christmas Special
programme.desc: Jeff Dunham invites Walter, Peanut, Bubba J.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquist’s dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Even with many leads, including an insulin overdose, a tooth infection and chronic lupus, the pieces don't add up in the case of a woman's death. Will Dr. G be able to uncover the truth?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame in a man's death or if there was a silent killer lurking in his body.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 69-year-old widower, Ernesto Vasquez is found dead on his porch with a loaded gun, a knife and three empty pill bottles.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A florist meets with clients for an upcoming wedding, but she suddenly collapses to the floor. With no apparent cause of death, Dr. G worries that this case may go unsolved.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In an unprecedented double autopsy, Dr. G is determined to find out who is accountable for these odd deaths and solve the mystery of a love triangle gone awry.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In a bizarre scene, 44-year-old Olga Petrova is found severely burnt in her home after a heated argument with her fiancé. Police want to question him and find out what happened, but he's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 45-year-old Natalie, who's visiting her sister from Australia, is found dead the morning after a heated argument with her estranged brother-in-law. Dr. G suspects foul play and she must race against the clock to give the police and Natalie's family the answers they need.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After suffering an apparent seizure, 37-year-old Ruben Delgado is found lifeless by his girlfriend.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman is killed in a drunk driving accident. At first, her death seems to be an open-and-shut case, but Dr. G discovers clues that the woman may have played a key role in her own death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A florist meets with clients for an upcoming wedding, but she suddenly collapses to the floor. With no apparent cause of death, Dr. G worries that this case may go unsolved.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a man died as a result of his infected stab wound or if his history of drug abuse was the culprit.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A teacher excuses himself for a nap after dinner, but he never wakes up. The man has a complex medical history that leads Dr. G on a hunt for an explanation to his mysterious death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G has a challenge on her hands: a victim's body spent days decaying before it was found, and decomposition could get in the way of her investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G suspects that someone is responsible for a vagrant's unusual death. She'll only discover the truth by finding answers to the strange events surrounding this curious case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects. Dr. G discovers several clues that bolster the child abuse theory, but the case is not clear cut.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's third programme is Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front. Big soul momma, owner Charita Jones, produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault but the punters are nowhere to be seen, Head Chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey - and despite working a seven-day week Charita's got an empty restaurant and a ~£65,000 debt.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The pressure is on for the remaining 18 young home cooks, who must debone an entire fish and make a MASTERCHEF worthy dish, or be at risk in a challenge. Not only are there big stakes at hand – the winner will receive a special advantage worthy of the effort – but the cooks also bring heart to the table as they reveal how their cultural heritages influence their cooking styles.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 16 home cooks face a sticky situation when they are divided into three teams and tasked with a Gordon masterclass – make as many stunning English trifles as possible in under 20 minutes. Only one team proves they have enough creativity and finesse to bypass the elimination round, the remaining home cooks are challenged to make three identical sliders.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to visit Hot Potato Cafe. He finds an owner sapped of passion who has created a toxic environment filled with negativity.

programme.desc: While in New Jersey, Chef Ramsay visits Flamango's, an outdated eatery in need of help. Ramsay suggests a major overhaul, but the owner thinks it's best to simply shut down the restaurant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don will be cutting back his delphiniums and adding a touch of the exotic to his Jewel Garden. Carol Klein is in Kent meeting lavender expert and breeder, Dr Simon Charlesworth, whose stunning walled garden is packed with many varieties of this beautifully scented plant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For many gardeners, the beginning of September is the start of a new season. Monty Don embraces this shift as he harvests an abundance of delicious produce, at the same time as looking ahead to the spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds some foxtail lilies to his dry garden, Carol Klein visits salvia expert William Dyson in Kent, and we meet a remarkable woman from a family of gardeners on the eve of her 100th birthday.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don cuts back his wildflower meadow and, with an eye on some early season colour next year, makes a start on planting up his spring containers. Joe Swift learns the importance of allotment bee keeping when he visits a plot in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow, Monty Don meets world-renowned garden designer, Piet Oudolf, at his latest creation in Somerset. He gets to grips with Oudolf's iconic naturalistic planting and explains how we can adapt this style to our very own gardens. Meanwhile, Carol Klein goes tree climbing in Bristol to find out how important these precious havens are for urban wildlife.

programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ferrari Dino, AMC Javelin, Buicks and Alfas
programme.desc: With the help of a friend, Tom discovers a cache of rare and forgotten cars hidden away in Virginia. Next, Tom visits two other friends to check out their interesting collections of cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A Jaguar E-Type story, and What To Do With a Late Friend's Car Collection?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hears some fun stories from the longtime owner of dilapidated Jaguar E-Type. Next, Tom meets a man who was made executor of his late friend's will. Specifically, he was tasked with managing his unique car collection.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Toyotas, BMWs, Nissans, Acuras and More!
programme.desc: This episode features THREE of Jason Cammisa's Ultimate Drag Race Replays. You'll see cars from BMW, Lexus, Toyota, VW, Hyundai and Acura.

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Porsche Stories: The new 911 GT3 and wild history of the 924
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa argues why the Porsche GT3 is now, unquestionably, the most important car in the 911 lineup.Next, Jason explores the wild history of the Porsche 924 and why it was never meant to be a Porsche.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: The Appraiser | 2020 Ford GT, 1976 Pontiac Trans-Am, Aston Martin DB4
programme.desc: Colin tries to put a value on a 2020 Ford GT that has one of the most desirable paint combinations and trim packages you could get in 2020. After that, Colin focuses his attention on a 1967 Pontiac Trans-Am and a 1962 Aston Martin DB4.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchple | New Shelby Cobra, Original Mazda RX-7 FD
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the BRAND NEW Shelby Cobra. Does it live up to the legend? Next, Henry does a retro review on a completely original Mazda RX-7 FD.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | 2025 Aston Martin Vantage and Bentley Continental GT
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews latest Aston Martin Vantage, equipped with a powerful twin-turbo V-8. Next, Henry drives the Bentley Continental GT which, while losing it's legendary W-12 engine, still provides a ton of fun via a hybrid-enhanced turbo V-8.

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Expensive Toyotas, and the #1 GT-R Restoration Shop
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Bogotá, Colombia, to visit a world-famous Toyota Land Cruiser shop, The FJ Company. Next, Larry reveals the magic behind Garage Yoshida, the world's leading Nissan GT-R restoration shop.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Bugatti EB110 and Volkswagen XL1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the Quad-Turbo, V-12 Bugatti EB110. Next, he dives into a car most people don't know exists: the Volkswagen XL1, a car capable of 250 miles per gallon.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Fast Wagons: Audi RS4 Avant and BMW M3 Touring
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Quickest Cars Under $35K! Plus: Demon 170 vs. Lucid Sapphire!
programme.desc: First up, Jason races the quickest cars money can buy... for under $35,0000. Next, he crowns the quickest American car EVER in a battle between the Dodge SRT Demon 170 and the Lucid Air Sapphire.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The stories behind the Ford GT and original Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa tells the fascinating backstory of the 2005-2006 Ford GT.Next, Jason tells the story of the Ford Bronco, from the first generation to the current model.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Hong Kong's Underground Car Scene, and Nissan Hyper Force
programme.desc: Larry Chen checks out Hong Kong's underground car scene. Next, Larry gets the inside scoop on the newly revealed Nissan Hyper Force concept electric hyper-car.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the legendary "A-B-C" Kei Cars. To wrap things up, he dives into the story of Honda's first-ever passenger car, the S500.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Datsun 240Z and Porsche 911 Restomods
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole goes for a drive in MZR Roadsports Datsun 240Z restomod followed by an outing in Workshop 5001's amazing Porsche 911 restomod.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | Griot's Empire and Boo Boo's Garage
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours Griot's Garage which houses an amazing collection of vintage race cars. Next, Chris heads to Boo Boo's Garage where he finds and incredible collection of American classics.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1 (1)
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Spike Kohlbecker & Jade Avedisian.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - '32 Ford and Volvo Amazon
programme.desc: Chip Foose sits down to draw and share his thoughts on how the 1932 Ford Model B design is still relevant today.Next, Chip tweaks the design of a lesser-known European classic: the Volvo Amazon.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Mazda MX-5 and Alpine A110 R Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the latest Mazda MX-5 and the new Alpine A110 R.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - A Cobra Killer and a Time Machine
programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the oft-forgotten DeTomaso Mangusta.Next, Chip takes a crack at updating certain aspects of a DeLorean DMC-12 in an attempt to give it a more timeless appeal.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Bentley Continental GT and Lamborghini Huracán Tecnica Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Bentley Continental GT and the Lamborghini Huracán Tecnica

programme.title: The Appraiser | Custom 1970 Ford F100, 1988 Lamborghini LM002, 1971 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: In this episode, Colin Comer appraises a freshly built barn find 1970 Ford F100 pickup truck, an original-owner 1988 Lamborghini LM002 aka the “Rambo Lambo," and a 1971 Ford Bronco that has been used in some interesting off-road situations.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Corvettes vs. The World
programme.desc: We drag race the first-ever hybrid, all-wheel-drive Corvette E-Ray against two Italian Supercars: the Ferrari F8 and Lamborghini Huracan Evo RWD.After that, it's the 2023 C8 Corvette Z06 against a Porsche 992 GT3, a Ducati V4 SP2, and an Audi R8.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Roadtrip and the Fastest Porsche 959 Ever?
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the Tail of the Dragon in a Porsche GT4 RS before giving us a history lesson on the fastest Porsche 959 ever built.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Pontiac Fiero and Ford Taurus SHO
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa, we learn about the infamous Pontiac Fiero and the fastest, most expensive sedan Ford ever made... the Taurus SHO.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Liberty Walk Ferrari F40, Tokyo Drift IRL
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Japan to check out Libery Walk's "blasphemous" Ferrari F40 custom build. Next, Larry explores the not-so-secret underground car meet right after the Tokyo Auto Salon.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | 1100 HP Camaro and Corvette, Nissan's Secret to Success
programme.desc: Larry Chen meets up with Jun Hardcore to check out Rocket Bunny Racing's unique, high-horsepower classic Corvette and Camaro builds. Next, Larry discusses Nissans iconic car designs with "The KYZA" and Cody Walker, brother of Paul Walker.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole - The Rocketeer MX-V6 and new Renault 5 E-Tech
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the incredible Rocketeer MX-V6, a naturally aspirated, V-6 powered Mazda MX-5 Miata restomod. Next, Henry jumps in the new Renault 5 E-Tech: an affordable, fun EV for the masses?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | AMG GT on Mercedes Secret Test Track, plus the new Porsche 911
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole heads to Mercedes' secret test track to drive and review the newest AMG GT. After that, Henry jumps in the new HYBRID Porsche 911 GTS (992.2) and wonders if the added weight will adversely affect the legendary nameplate.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dodge Charger and a field full of project cars
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hunts for barn finds in Midland, TX, where he finds a 1972 Dodge Charger for sale. Tom then gets the stories behind a yard full of old project cars.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | A trio of incredible Mercedes sports cars
programme.desc: Henry drives Mercedes’ SLS AMG Black Series and AMG GT Black Series, two of the wildest, rarest, most expensive cars ever to emerge from Affalterbach.Next, another famous Merc takes center stage as Henry reviews the McLaren Mercedes SLR HDK.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole | Unique Porsche 911s
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of pair of unique Porsche's. First, it's the legendary Heigo 911 rally car. Next, Henry drives the incredible Ruf SCR that "technically" isn't a Porsche at all.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1969 COPO Camaro, 1969 Mustang Mach 1, and a 1969 Z/28 Camaro RS
programme.desc: Colin Comer starts this episode out with an original 1969 double COPO Camaro before moving onto a well-driven and well-loved 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. To wrap things up, Colin appraises a well-documented 1969 Chevy Camaro Z/28 "DZ-code."

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Ford Bronco and Chevy C8 Corvette
programme.desc: A first-gen Ford Brono gets the full Chip Foose hot rod treatment.Next, can Chip redesign the new mid-engine C8 Corvette to have a stronger connection to Corvettes of the past?

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa: Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E and Mustang GT
programme.desc: In this episode of ICONS, host Jason Cammisa talkes about why the Lucid Air is a time machine. Next, he directly compares the Ford Mach-E and the Mustang GT... and how they both stack up against the Tesla Model Y.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa: Toyota GR 86, and GR Corolla vs. GR Yaris
programme.desc: In this episode of ICONS, host Jason Cammisa reviews the Toyota GR 86 by comparing it to the Mk8 Volkswagen GTI and ND2 Mazda Miata. Next, Jason compares the the wild hot hatches from Toyota: the GR Corolla and the GR Yaris.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 367K-mile Barracuda, short-bed F100, & Ford Cortina GT Wagon
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hunts down a interesting Ford F100 short-bed pickup before coming across a Plymouth Barracuda with an incredible 367,000 miles on the odometer. Next, Tom finds the last Ford Cortina GT Wagon along with a handful of other rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Scouting before the season pays off as Dr. Duck finds the Mother Load on Public Land. Mallards are stacked in like cord wood now they just have to get the hole before someone else. programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With the fall of the Soviet Union, wildlife populations in Tajikistan were devastated, bringing some of their unique mountain species to the brink of extinction. With the help of funds generated through hunting, vast areas are now being conserved and protected. Dan Cabela explores this conservation success.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

Flashbacks reveal Oxford's passionate affair with Queen Elizabeth I and how -- in his younger days -- Oxford charmed her with plays like A Midsummer Night's Dream.

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: The heroic mariner must clear all sorts of hurdles in the way of rescuing a princess who’s been miniaturized and held captive by a ruthless magician.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: A stranded group of six Allied soldiers trek across the desert, making their way to an abandoned fort, but are soon faced with a German battalion.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Shockproof
programme.desc: Jenny Marsh (Patricia Knight) is a hard-luck dame who's just finished five years in the slammer for killing a man. Jenny's not exactly the murdering type -- she did the deed while defending her jailbird lover, Harry (John Baragrey), which is probably one reason she's attracted the attention of her parole officer, Griff Marat (Cornel Wilde). In fact, Griff is so taken with Jenny that he gets her a job caring for his ailing mother, but although Jenny tries to fly right, she's not yet over Harry.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: The Undercover Man
programme.desc: Determined Treasury Department investigator Frank Warren (Glenn Ford) goes after a ruthless mobster known as The Big Fellow. When a key informant is murdered, Warren pursues the gangster on charges of tax evasion. But, with a slick mob lawyer hampering him at every turn, and threats being lobbed toward Warren's wife (Nina Foch), the lawman's chances of achieving a conviction are slim to none. His only hope is that one syndicate bookkeeper will have the courage to turn state's evidence.

programme.title: Where Angels Go...Trouble Follows
programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana

programme.title: Murderer's Row

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Trail of the Rustlers
programme.desc: When a member of the villainous Mahoney family is slain while escaping the jail cell he'd been put in by Steve Armitage (Charles Starrett), aka the Durango Kid, the dead man's relatives vow to take down the Kid by any means necessary. Chick Mahoney (Don Harvey) poses as the Kid and tries to ruin the cowboy's reputation by stealing from nearby ranchers, but with the help of sidekick Smiley Burnette (Smiley Burnette), the Kid sets out to retrieve the stolen goods and repair his good name.

programme.title: The Return of Daniel Boone
programme.desc: The scout's grandson (Bill Elliott) foils land-grabbers; his sidekick (Dub Taylor) flirts with twins.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.
